sources.title: The Pointing Finger
sources.description: “Creaky quota quickie” (IMDB review quote). I agree with the IMDB reviewer. This musty crime melodrama creaks like a rusty gate hinge. Nevertheless it’s not without points of interest, especially if you’re curious about what the British equivalent of Mascot Pictures and Tiffany Productions were cranking out in the early ‘30s. IMDB rating 5.0. Adapted and directed by George Pearson. Released in 1933 (UK only). Complete print ?

sources.title: The Pointing Finger
sources.description: Title: The Pointing Finger Summary: Deep in debt, the Honorable James Mallory plots to murder his cousin, Lord Rollestone, so he claim the earldom and inheritance. Directed by: George Pearson Actors: John Stuart, Viola Keats, Leslie Perrins Production Company: Real Art Productions Release Date: 30 April 1934 (UK) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Deep in debt, the Honorable James Mallory plots to murder his cousin, Lord Rollestone, so he claim the earldom and inheritance.
